pageTitle: College of Education Media Center Kits and Games - Acquisitions and Discovery (Public) - NCSU Libraries
textBeforeTable: Descriptive Metadata Procedure Create brief RDA records in Sirsi only. Do not contribute records to OCLC. Original cataloging Edit records according to local procedure. Do not remove data if supplied in record. Only add data that is required locally. Accept OCLC records as found. Retain and edit using exisiting cataloging code (e.g. if record is AACR2, edit in AACR2) Prefer fullest level OCLC record when available. Copy cataloging Policy The College of Education Media Center (CoEMC), formerly the Learning Resource Center (LRL), regularly receives kits and game materials. This policy addresses the local cataloging of these resources. CoEMC purchases and receives materials as kits. Additionally, CoEMC takes accompanying or other materials and requests that M&C catalog these materials as a kit. Mathematics manipulatives and readers both fall under the latter category. A separate policy exists for College of Education Media Center Mathematics Manipulatives kits. For other created kits, please consult your supervisor. Help Viewing restrictions apply
textAfterTable: Classification Kits and games are classified according to their topical subject area. Subject Analysis In addition to any topically relevant headings, include ONE of the following: LCSH (650) Use English language $x Study and teaching $x Foreign speakers Use for: English as a second langauge. Include heading for other language. French language   German language   Language arts   Mathematics   Reading   Social sciences Use for: Social studies Spanish language   If appropriate, include any of the following topical headings: LCSH (650) Educational games Board games Puppets Call Number/Item Record Call library = LRL Type = KIT Item library
